byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Greeleyville, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Washington, and Katie Rogers from New York.
byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Officials say fire at Mount Zion African Methodist Episcopal Church, black church in Greeleyville, SC, was likely caused by by lightning and there is no evidence of arson.
lead_paragraph: The F.B.I.’s initial assessment is that there was no sign of arson and that lightning was probably to blame for a fire at a church in Greeleyville, S.C., a law enforcement official said.

headline.main: Lightning Believed Cause of Fire at a Black Church
headline.print_headline: Lightning Believed Cause of Fire at a Black Church

snippet: The F.B.I.’s initial assessment is that there was no sign of arson and that lightning was probably to blame for a fire at a church in Greeleyville, S.C., a law enforcement official said.
